Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: 0.05 manat for each excise stamp issued goes to Compulsory Medical Insurance.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: 1% of revenues collected from tobacco taxes are used to finance the national programme for tobacco control.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: 1% of revenues from tobacco excise are used to  finance a Physical Education and Sport Support Fund.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: 1% of the total customs and tax fees are deducted for the national program for tobacco control, as implemented by the Customs Authority.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: 10% of revenue from the contribution to the employment fund levied on cigarettes is assigned to the public health support fund.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: 10% of the annual tobacco excise tax revenues are allocated to fund healthcare coverage subscription costs for citizens who are not working and are at least sixty (60) years of age or disabled, and 10% of taxes on alcohol and tobacco are allocated to non-

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: 10% surcharge imposed on tobacco excise; at least 50% of its proceeds are allocated for health programmes and law enforcement at the regional level, 75% of which is deducted by the National Government to fund National Health Insurance. Additionally, 2% of

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: 15% of the total revenue from tobacco products for the implementation of the WHO FCTC.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: 2% of excise on tobacco and alcohol are directed to the Thaihealth fund. Another 2% are directed to a Sports Promotion fund and also 2% of excise directed to the Elder support fund.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: 20 per cent of the revenues from the Special Consumption Tax on cigarettes is directed to the National Health Fund.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: 20% of taxes collected from tobacco products are used for the promotion of sports in Benin.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: 25% of tobacco excise revenues are directed to a  Health Tax Fund. Health Hazard of 0.30 NPR per piece of bidi, 0.60 per piece of cigarette and cigar and NPR 60 per kg of smokeless tobacco (chewing surti, Khaini, Gutka, Pan masala) is levied on locally pr

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: 3.5% of excise revenues earmarked to Cultural Endowment of Estonia, including 0.5% transferred to the physical fitness and sport endowment.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: 35% of revenues from excise taxes on tobacco, alcohol and  firearms, ammunition and explosives fund FOSALUD (the solidarity fund for health).

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: 5.4% of the total excise tax revenue is allocated to the social cohesion fund which finances, among other activities, health care for the poor and physically handicapped.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: 50% of excise revenues are distributed to Ministry of Health for NCD programs,

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: 50% of the total excise tax collection from tobacco products shall be allocated and used exclusively in the following manner: (1) 80% to PhilHealth for the implementation of the Universal Health Care Law; and (2) 20% shall be allocated for medical assista

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: A 2% levy on all tobacco products manufactured or imported into the country.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: A contribution from the excise tax on obacco  (0.026 CHF per pack of cigarettes and 1.73 CHF per kg of net mass of fine cut tobacco ) is directed to the Tobacco Prevention fund.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: A Health Development Surcharge of 1% of the Maximum Retail Price of tobacco products.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: A portion of the 5% extra tax on tobacco is directed to the Ministry of Sports and another portion to hospital emergencies.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: A surcharge of 2% of the excise tax based to finance a Fund for Tobacco Control.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: About 53% of excise revenues from tobacco and alcohol used to fund the universal health insurance.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: Additional taxes on tobacco products (6 Ariary  per pack of cigarettes, 50 Ariary per pack of cigars or cigarillos and 1 Ariary per pack of chewing tobacco) are directed to finance the Office for National Tobacco Control, the National Fund for the Promoti

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: All revenues from the excise tax on tobacco are used for health programmes.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: All revenues from the specific excise tax (509.40 CRC per pack) are used to fund programs for the prevention and treatment of diseases related to tobacco use, cancer treatment, harmful use of alcohol, and sports.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: An amount of 841 KRW per 20 sticks of cigarettes is directed to the National Health Promotion Fund which finances health promotion research and projects including tobacco control. The following amounts are also used from other tobacco and nicotine product

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: An extra 0.1 EGP per pack is levied to fund the student health insurance &  1.0 EGP   per pack is levied  to fund the national health insurance.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: Each year tobacco excise receipts of not more â‚¬167.605 million are paid over to the Minister for Health. The Minister for Finance determines the amount.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: Fifty percent (50%) of the tobacco tax revenues collected are directed to the National Institute of Oncology, the Ministry of Health for cessation services, and Customs to combat the illicit trade of tobacco products.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: From total excise tobacco tax revenues, 40% are directed to the Ministry of Public Health and Social Welfare,  18% to the National Devolopment Sports Fund and 5% to the National Fund for Solidarity Resources for Health 5%.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: Import duty will be used in health programs.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: One percent of the funds received in the state budget from excise taxes on tobacco products and alcoholic beverages are used to finance the national programs for reduction of tobacco and tobacco products use, of alcohol consumption as well as the preventi

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: Proceeds of an additional tax of 2% of producer price of cigarettes are directed to the AIDS programme and for tobacco control; proceeds of another additional tax are directed to sports.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: Revenue from an additional tax of 7% of the declared import value of cigarettes is spent on anti-cancer research.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: Revenues from an additional tax on cigarettes support an emergency fund and medical care.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: The Additional Emergency Tax is allocated in its entirety to the National Social Security Administration (ANSES).

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: The National Calamity Contingency Fund (NCCF) now renamed the National Disaster Response Fund (NDRF) under the 2005 Disaster Management Act, is a fund managed by the central government for "meeting the expenses for emergency response, relief and rehabilit

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: The state will contribute at least ten percent of the collection of the excise on cigarettes, rums, spirits, drinks, soft drinks and beers for the budget of sports, physical education and recreation.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: The total proceeds from the ad valorem tobacco excise tax (10% of retail price) and most proceeds form the specific tobacco excise are used to fund the national health insurance. Additionally, a smaller proportion of the specific excise tax funds sports.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: Tobacco Levy: 30% of cost of production or Cost Insurance Freight (CIF) price for imported tobacco.

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: Two percent of tobacco excise tax is collected for the Health Promotion Fund, in accordance with the amended Law on Government Special Funds (2019) and article 10.2 of the Tobacco Control Law (2013).

Indicator: Reported use of earmarked tobacco taxes
Value: Varies by State. Amount per pack funds different types of activities, mainly health activities.
